"I didn't expect to see you here.": "If you have the time, would you care to talk?"
"Thanks."
"I'm currently initiating some newcomers to ARKS, you see."

"I figured we could talk while I
wait for them to finish running the Trainia."
"Moving right along, here's what I wanted to ask."
"How has Manon been doing lately?"
"Did something happen?"
"What do you mean?"

"Manon is an outstanding ARKS member.
As a combatant, as an engineer, and as a researcher."

"However, something seems to be troubling her.
I fear that it may affect her for the worse."
"Perhaps you've noticed it as well. Some sort of darkness Manon seems to carry with her."

"Manon is an outstanding ARKS member, but I fear
that aspect may be some sort of ill omen."
"I know not what could be causing Manon's grief."

"If she isn't going to come forth and talk about it,
perhaps we should look into it ourselves."

"Hesitation and doubt can
dull one's judgment in battle."
"At times, it can even be the trigger for causing the wrong decision to be made."
"Indeed, mistakes made on the battlefield affect not only oneself, but those around you."
"...This is but one of my rules of thumb in battle."

"Aina has chosen to fully confront her past,
in order to be able to move beyond it."
"Manon, on the other hand, seems to have been bottling things up."
"It will likely cause her to break if she doesn't deal with it..."
"If you wish to help Manon, I'd like you to try to ease that burden from her."

"You and Aina have always been with her,
so you should be able to notice any slight changes."
"A team is not just a gathering of forces."
"A true team is also a gathering of hearts and minds."
"I would like you to keep that in mind."
"...Phew. I've started to sound rather preachy."
"Well, my trainees should be just about done with their Trainia exercise."
"Sorry to cut it short, but let's leave our conversation at that."
"Thanks for hearing me out."
"Take care of Manon."
